result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:48 AM Defendant Justin J Geier in court.  Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren appeared by video for Justin J Geier.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defense requests to set plea/sentencing hearing on open cases. Court sets.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Comply with all conditions in 21 CM 1331 and 21 CM 1468.Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.

2:12 PM Defendant Justin J Geier in court, in custody. Attorney Ricardo Tapia appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Atty. Tapia states Atty. Lindgren is appointed on his other cases.  Court will extend the appointment from the defendant other cases to this case if Atty. Lindgren agrees.NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
